cab.content: 73SECRET, Q.T,-4527.WAR CABINET,0 P E RATION S.From:- War Office. Despatched 6.10 p,m, 11,5.18,To:- General Spiers.58202 Cypher. Following from General Wilson to Monsieur Olemenceau. Your telegram 7459 B.S./3 of 11th May. In accordance with the decisions of the C.S. de Guerre we have been hard at work trying to arrange for the disposal of the Czecho-Slovaks. The . difficulty is one of transport. Owing to the concen-tration of all British and American shipping on the trans-portation of American troops to France at present there is none available, and we hesitate to ask the Japanese to devote shipping to this purpose at the very moment, when we are pressing Japan to send an expedition to Siberia which will absorb all her shipping. It is necessary mean-while to keep together and if possible increase the Gzecho-Slovaks troops, who are undoubtedly a valuable fighting force. However, I agree that to do this, greater precision is required as to our relative responsi-bilities with regard to them. We propose, therefore, that: -1* All Czecho-Slovaks now at Vladivostock, or on their way there, should be taken in charge by the French, who should send such officers as may be required to organise them into efficient units. It is evident that they must be kept under discipline and in training pending the time when it will be possible to ship them from that port, It is a matter for future consideration whether, if it takes a long time to collect the necessary transports, it may not be desirable for the time being to use these troops, or a part of them, in conjunction with the Japanese advance into Siberia. This would help to give it more of an International character.2. All Czecho-Slovaks not already at Vladivostok or on their way there, as well as the Serbs referred to in your telegram No. 7459 B.S./3 to be directed to Murmansk or Archangel, preferably the latter, as at this season the Murmansk railway is very unreliable. The British Government to be responsible for the Czecho-Slovaks and Serbs arriving at these ports, as the French are for those at Vladivostock. When the locald efence of the ports and adjoining country is assured as many of them as can be spared, will be transported to France as soon as shipping can be collected.
